sn5.8:1.2: Then the nun Sīsupacālā robed up in the morning …
sn5.8:1.3: and sat at the root of a tree for the day’s meditation.
sn5.8:1.4: Then Māra the Wicked went up to Sīsupacālā and said to her,
sn5.8:1.5: “Nun, whose creed do you believe in?”
sn5.8:1.6: “I don’t believe in anyone’s creed, sir.”
sn5.8:2.1: “In whose name did you shave your head?
sn5.8:2.3: but you don’t believe in any creed.
sn5.8:2.4: Why do you live as if lost?”
sn5.8:3.3: But I don’t believe in their teaching,
sn5.8:3.4: for they’re no experts in the Dhamma.
sn5.8:4.1: But there is one born in the Sakyan clan,
sn5.8:5.3: He has attained the end of all deeds,
sn5.8:5.4: freed with the ending of attachments.
sn5.8:5.5: That Blessed One is my Teacher,
sn5.8:5.6: and I believe in his instruction.”
sn5.8:6.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The nun Sīsupacālā knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
